page.title: 04HOUSES IN GLADESTRY VILLAGE
page.content: We did a survey of Gladestry. We asked the name of the house and the people, their work, the age of the house, and if they were local or from off. We counted 42 houses. Of the houses 19 were built this century. The others were a hundred to five hundred years old. Some of the very old houses start to fall down, and rich people from off buy them and repair them. There are some new bungalows. The newest ones have stone tile roofs so that they fit in with the old houses. There is a big new bungalow with 18 rooms and a swimming pool. There are some council houses which were built for people who could not afford to buy a house, but most of these have been bought by the people who live in them. An unusual house is Capel Anydd which is made from an old chapel.
